column5: hey guys, what knot do you usualy use when tieing a leader to your main line, on the rig used for bootom fishing, or perch rig for winter ?
The blood knot works quite well for me. I just gotta figure out how to do it in the dark.  http://www.animatedknots.com/bloodknot/index.php

for attaching a leader i use a surgeons knot simple and strong.

fishinfool, The Blood Knot is used to join two lines of similar size, e.g., when joining sections of leader or tippet. snowball, i edited the picture so you way wont work, i want my leader to be of smaller size
I would use try either the uni to uni or my favorite knot the Alberto ( variation of the albright knot) easy to tie and very strong do a google search if you are interested in the Alberto knot .
i like the swivel idea. will attach it to main line using palomar knot
